abstract: South Sudan lawmakers extend term of Pres Salva Kiir by three years, expressing need for stability as country deals with uprising led by Riek Machar, former deputy president; extension of legislature's tenure is also approved.
lead_paragraph: Lawmakers in South Sudan voted Tuesday to extend the term of President Salva Kiir by three years.

headline.main: South Sudan: Vote for Status Quo
headline.print_headline: Africa; South Sudan: Vote for Status Quo

snippet: Lawmakers in South Sudan voted Tuesday to extend the term of President Salva Kiir by three years.
